intro.speaker: Rinkah
intro.line: Ah, you’re awake. Sorry about that bump on your head.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It’s you! From the Flame Tribe, right? Where are we?

intro.speaker: Rinkah
intro.line: Yes, I am Rinkah. This is a Flame Tribe village within Hoshido’s territory. I’m going to hand you over to the Hoshidan authorities.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see. I suppose they’ll want to hear an explanation for the unprovoked attack. And then they’ll probably execute me.

intro.speaker: Rinkah
intro.line: Heh. I don’t think so.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Gods…they’re here already, aren’t they?

intro.speaker: Rinkah
intro.line: Yes. It’s time to go.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We meet again. Kaze, right?

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Yes. I’m glad we found you, Prince/Princess Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You are? Wait, am I missing something?

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Please come with me. All will be explained.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Very well.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Welcome back, Kaze. Good work.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Thank you, Lord Ryoma.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Did…did you just say Lord Ryoma?

intro.speaker: Rinkah
intro.line: Yes, this is the high prince of Hoshido, Lord Ryoma.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I understand.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Hmm…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What are you waiting for? If you’re going to execute me, please get on with it.

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: I cannot believe it is really you…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I’m sorry, do we know each other?

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: Oh, I’ve missed you so much! Come here, Corrin, my sweet child!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Your sweet child?! What are you talking about? That’s not possible…

intro.speaker: Mikoto
intro.line: Oh, my poor Corrin. It’s a sad story. When you were very young, you were abducted by forces from Nohr. I am your mother, Mikoto. All this time, I didn’t know if I’d ever see you again!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But King Garon is my father! None of what you’re saying makes sense.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: It must be quite a shock, but I assure you that she speaks the truth. I am your elder brother, Ryoma.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No, no, no… Xander is my older brother! Leo, Elise, and Camilla are my siblings…

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Are those the Nohrian royals? They’re not your real family. I still remember the day you were taken. In those days, there was tension between Hoshido and Nohr, but no full-blown war. Not until King Garon lured King Sumeragi-our father-to Cheve under false pretenses. He said it was for a peace conference. Ha! His real plan was to murder our father in cold blood. And to make matters even worse…he kidnapped you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No. That’s just not possible…

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: You really don’t remember any of this? Not even a single memory?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No. Honestly, I have only the vaguest memories from my early childhood…

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: These are times when I can sense something beneath the surface… A blurry image. Like a stone at the bottom of a lake, shimmering and ethereal. But that’s it. Nothing of substance.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Well, I can’t imagine the Nohrian royals would share much of the past with you. I know this is a lot to take in.

intro.speaker: Hoshidan
intro.line: Lord Ryoma! I have an urgent message. We’re under attack from the north!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: No! Hinoka and Sakura are in that area right now!

intro.speaker: Hoshidan
intro.line: Yes, milord. I’ve been told that they’re working to help evacuate the villagers.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Very well. We’ll need to provide support. I’ll leave immediately. Corrin, will you come with me? I want you to see the truth with your own eyes.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Sorry I’m slowing us down. Of all the times to sprain an ankle…

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Don’t worried about it, Sis. We’ll be OK. These stupid beasts don’t stand a chance against me.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I hope you’re right…

battle.speaker: Ryoma
battle.line: Hold strong, Sisters! I’m coming for you!

battle.speaker: Hinoka
battle.line: Do your worst, monsters. I promise I can be meaner than you!

battle.speaker: Sakura
battle.line: I’m not scared of these things…as long as Hinoka is close by!

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Oh, thank you, kind warrior! Everyone in our village is so grateful. Please, take this. Good luck!

battle-talk.speaker: Corrin
battle-talk.line: Hey, are you all right? We’re here to help.

battle-talk.speaker: Hinoka
battle-talk.line: Yeah, we’re fine. Who are you? I thought I knew most of my brother’s troops. Anyway, I appreciate the help, but it’s really not necessary. It takes more than a few dozen 800-pound monsters to bring me down!

battle-talk.speaker: Corrin
battle-talk.line: Well, I’m glad you’re feeling confident. Just know that we’ve got your back.

battle-talk.speaker: Hinoka
battle-talk.line: I didn’t mean to be dismissive. Thank you for coming all the way out here. I owe you one…so take this. You can use it in a pinch to heal your wounds. Now really, don’t worry about me. I’m at my best in situations like this!

battle-talk.speaker: Corrin
battle-talk.line: Thank you. I’ll use this wisely.

battle-talk.speaker: Hinoka
battle-talk.line: Hey, you never did tell me your name.

battle-talk.speaker: Corrin
battle-talk.line: Oh, sorry. I’m Corrin. Nice to meet you.

battle-talk.speaker: Hinoka
battle-talk.line: Corrin? Corrin?! This can’t be a coincidence!

battle-talk.speaker: Corrin
battle-talk.line: Hey! Are you OK? We’re here to help.

battle-talk.speaker: Sakura
battle-talk.line: Oh! Th-thank you so much. Yes, we’re OK…for n-now.

battle-talk.speaker: Corrin
battle-talk.line: Excellent. I think we have things under control at the moment. But please stay back for the time bring. We’ll take care of the rest of the monsters.

battle-talk.speaker: Sakura
battle-talk.line: Yes, of c-course. Oh. I didn’t even get a chance to ask his/her name…

character-falls.speaker: Hinoka
character-falls.line: Ugh! I lost to that... THING.

character-falls.speaker: Sakura
character-falls.line: Hinoka! You've taken too much damage. Please, you must retreat!

character-falls.speaker: Hinoka
character-falls.line: Never! Urk... Well, maybe just this once...

character-falls.speaker: Corrin
character-falls.line: I wasn't prepared for this! I'm sorry, I can't go on...

character-falls.speaker: Ryoma
character-falls.line: Corrin, no! How could I let this happen...

character-falls.speaker: Hinoka
character-falls.line: Sakura, get out of here! You can't possibly go on!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Er, hello. I’m sorry to bother you. I just got lost in your singing. There is something about that song captivated me…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I’m Azura. A former princess of Nohr.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Former? I don’t understand. If that were true, surely I would have heard of you. I grew up with the Nohrian royal family…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I’m afraid I’ve been here a long time. After you were taken by the Nohrians, the Hoshidan forces retaliated. They tried desperately to get you back, but they failed again and again. However, I wasn’t as heavily guarded. Hoshidan ninja easily kidnapped me. I suppose we’ve both been hostages for most of our lives…

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: No, it’s OK. I may technically be a hostage, but I’ve lived a happy life. The people of Hoshido have accepted me as one of their own. Even Queen Mikoto herself treats me as if I were her daughter.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Did something happen between you and Queen Mikoto?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No. I just don’t know what to do. She seems perfectly lovely, but I don’t feel any connection to her. But she loves me. And so do all my blood siblings-who I’ve just met.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I understand. If I were to return to Nohr, I suspect I’d feel the same way.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Do you think you could start over there? Live a new life among strangers?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: No. Given a choice, I would prefer to stay here in Hoshido. Queen Mikoto is a peace-loving ruler. King Garon is not.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: So, Corrin…what are you going to do?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I don’t know. For now, I’m just going to spend some time thinking.

cutscene.speaker: Azura
cutscene.line: Yet the waters ever change, flowing like time. The path is yours to climb.
